news.title: Mahavatar Narsimha Creates History with Record-Breaking Pre-Release Business
news.author: Raj Sharma
news.excerpt: The animated epic has secured theatrical rights worth ₹150 crores even before release
news.content: In an unprecedented move for Indian animation, Mahavatar Narsimha has secured theatrical distribution rights worth ₹150 crores across India. Major multiplex chains including PVR, INOX, and Cinepolis have committed to over 3500 screens for the opening weekend.

news.title: Rana Daggubati Completes Voice Recording for Lord Narasimha
news.author: Priya Menon
news.excerpt: The Baahubali star spent 6 months perfecting the divine roar
news.content: Rana Daggubati has completed the voice recording for his role as Lord Narasimha. The actor underwent special voice training to achieve the perfect blend of divinity and ferocity required for the character. He recorded the dialogues in Telugu, Hindi, and Tamil.

news.title: MM Keeravani's Musical Magic: 7 Original Compositions for Mahavatar
news.author: Anupama Chopra
news.excerpt: The Oscar-winning composer creates divine soundscape with Prague Philharmonic
news.content: Fresh from his Oscar win for RRR, MM Keeravani has composed 7 original tracks for Mahavatar Narsimha. The soundtrack was recorded with the Prague Philharmonic Orchestra, featuring a blend of classical Indian instruments and western orchestration.

news.title: First Look: Stunning Animation Showcases India's VFX Evolution
news.author: Anil Wanvari
news.excerpt: Unreal Engine 5 brings photorealistic quality to Indian mythology
news.content: The first look of Mahavatar Narsimha has stunned audiences with its photorealistic animation quality. Using Unreal Engine 5, the team has created breathtaking visuals that rival international productions. The hair simulation alone took 6 months to perfect.

news.title: Special Screening Planned at 500 Narasimha Temples Across India
news.author: Rajesh Kumar
news.excerpt: Unique initiative to bring mythology to devotees
news.content: In a first-of-its-kind initiative, the makers have partnered with temple trusts to organize special screenings at 500 Narasimha temples across India. These screenings will be free for devotees and will include educational workshops on the mythology.

news.title: International Distribution: Film to Release in 25 Countries
news.author: Rebecca Davis
news.excerpt: Major push for Indian animation in global markets
news.content: Mahavatar Narsimha will see the widest international release for an Indian animated film, spanning 25 countries including USA, UK, UAE, Australia, and Singapore. The film will be released with subtitles in 10 languages.

news.title: Prahlada's Character to Inspire Children's Educational Program
news.author: Dr. Sunita Sharma
news.excerpt: CBSE partners for mythology education initiative
news.content: The character of young Prahlada will be featured in a special educational program for schools. CBSE has partnered with the filmmakers to create study materials that teach values of courage, devotion, and righteousness through the story.

news.title: Behind the Scenes: 500 Artists, 4 Years of Dedication
news.author: Jitesh Pillaai
news.excerpt: The monumental effort behind India's biggest animated film
news.content: Mahavatar Narsimha employed over 500 artists working across Mumbai, Hyderabad, and Bangalore. The production spanned 4 years with over 2 million man-hours invested. Each frame of the climactic transformation scene took 48 hours to render.

news.title: Merchandise Launch: Action Figures and Art Books Hit Stores
news.author: Amit Mudgill
news.excerpt: ₹50 crore merchandise market expected
news.content: The official merchandise including action figures, art books, and apparel has launched across 200 stores. Early sales indicate strong demand, with Narasimha action figures selling out within hours. The merchandise market is expected to generate ₹50 crores.

news.title: Celebrity Reactions Pour In After Special Preview Screening
news.author: Himesh Mankad
news.excerpt: SS Rajamouli calls it 'a milestone in Indian cinema'
news.content: A special preview screening for industry celebrities has generated overwhelming positive responses. SS Rajamouli tweeted, 'Mahavatar Narsimha is not just a film, it's a spiritual experience. Proud of Indian animation reaching these heights.' Other celebrities including Prabhas, Jr NTR, and Karan Johar shared similar sentiments.

news.title: Film Receives U Certificate, Suitable for All Ages
news.author: Shubhra Gupta
news.excerpt: CBFC praises the film's positive message and values
news.content: The Central Board of Film Certification has awarded Mahavatar Narsimha a U certificate, making it suitable for all age groups. The board particularly praised the film's portrayal of dharma, devotion, and the triumph of good over evil without excessive violence.

news.title: Advanced Booking Opens: 50,000 Tickets Sold in First Hour
news.author: Trade Analyst
news.excerpt: Unprecedented demand for animated film in India
news.content: Advanced bookings for Mahavatar Narsimha opened at midnight and witnessed extraordinary response with 50,000 tickets sold within the first hour. Major cities like Mumbai, Delhi, Hyderabad, and Bangalore are showing near-full occupancy for the opening weekend.

news.title: Sanskrit Scholars Praise Authentic Depiction of Mythology
news.author: Dr. Raghavan
news.excerpt: Film consulted 50+ scholars for scriptural accuracy
news.content: Leading Sanskrit scholars and mythology experts have praised the film's authentic depiction of the Narasimha avatar story. The filmmakers consulted over 50 scholars to ensure accuracy in portraying the Puranic narratives, mantras, and cultural elements.

news.title: Special 4DX Experience to Launch in 50 Theaters
news.author: Kiran Rao
news.excerpt: Immersive technology brings divine experience to audiences
news.content: Mahavatar Narsimha will be the first Indian animated film to release in 4DX format across 50 theaters. The 4DX version features motion seats, wind, water, and scent effects synchronized with the action, particularly enhancing the climactic transformation scene.

news.title: Film Festival Circuit: Selected for Annecy Animation Festival
news.author: Jean-Pierre Blanc
news.excerpt: Indian animation makes mark at world's premier animation festival
news.content: Mahavatar Narsimha has been officially selected for the prestigious Annecy International Animation Film Festival 2025. This marks a significant achievement for Indian animation on the global stage. The film will compete in the Feature Film category.

news.title: YouTube Trailer Crosses 20 Million Views in 3 Days
news.author: Digital Desk
news.excerpt: Trailer becomes most-watched Indian animation trailer
news.content: The official trailer of Mahavatar Narsimha has crossed 20 million views on YouTube within 3 days of release, making it the most-watched trailer for an Indian animated film. The trailer is trending #1 in India and several other countries.

news.title: Gaming Tie-in: Mobile Game Based on Film Launches
news.author: Ravi Sundaram
news.excerpt: Action-adventure game lets players experience the epic story
news.content: A mobile game based on Mahavatar Narsimha has launched on iOS and Android platforms. The action-adventure game allows players to play as Prahlada and experience key moments from the film. The game has already crossed 1 million downloads.

news.title: Motion Capture Technology: Bringing Divinity to Life
news.author: Tech Editor
news.excerpt: Advanced mocap brings realistic movement to animated characters
news.content: The production utilized state-of-the-art motion capture technology to create realistic character movements. Professional dancers and martial artists performed the action sequences, which were then enhanced with animation to create the perfect blend of realism and divine aesthetics.

news.title: Brand Partnerships: Major Sponsors Come Onboard
news.author: Business Desk
news.excerpt: ₹25 crore brand partnership deals signed
news.content: Major brands including Parle, Britannia, and Amazon have partnered with Mahavatar Narsimha for promotional tie-ins. The total brand partnership value exceeds ₹25 crores, with special edition products and co-branded campaigns planned.

news.title: Film Inspires Narasimha Jayanti Celebrations Nationwide
news.author: Tradition Editor
news.excerpt: Film release timed with auspicious festival
news.content: The release of Mahavatar Narsimha is strategically timed with Narasimha Jayanti celebrations. Temples across India are planning special events, with film screenings, cultural programs, and devotional activities inspired by the movie's themes.
